snippet: Insurance companies are canceling millions of health insurance plans that fail to meet minimum standards, and a look at the stories of three people with such plans tells a complex tale.
abstract: Health care insurance companies are canceling millions of individual plans that fail to meet minimum standards of health care reform law as insurance marketplaces open; dropped plans have become political talking point, one that Republicans point to as evidence of Pres Obama's flawed ambitions; examination of cases of three privately insured Americans with such plans tells complex tale.

byline.original: By KATIE THOMAS and REED ABELSON

lead_paragraph: Insurance companies are canceling millions of health insurance plans that fail to meet minimum standards, and a look at the stories of three people with such plans tells a complex tale.

headline.main: When Insurers Drop Policies: Three Stories
headline.print_headline: When Insurers Drop Policies: Three Stories
